Setting.Name: Number of partitions for k-fold cross-validation test

Comment.Text: Signal processing Each frequency is treated separately. There are two important boxes in the processing chain : Temporal filter extracts a single frequency band. It should be configured by a file generated by the configuration scenario. Target Separator separates targets used to mark one frequency from the others and sends stimulations to corresponding outputs (Target/Non-Target).
Signal processing for the first stimulation frequency

Feature extraction Finally the classifier receives values of amplitude for stimulated and non-stimulated periods and trains to distinguish the two. One classifier is trained per each stimulation frequency.
Signal processing for the third stimulation frequency
Signal processing for the third stimulation frequency
Signal processing for the second stimulation frequency

Scenario description This step will use the signal recorded during the previous step training acquisition to generate classifiers which are in turn usable in online BCI applications. Important : Do not forget to change the settings in the Generic stream reader to load the file you recorded in the previous step. By default the scenario uses example data provided with OpenViBE. Notice : this scenario will work for three stimulation frequencies. If you wish to use more than three commands in your applications, you will have to modify it. This modification is pretty straightforward just duplicate a branch of the processing chain and change the files used by boxes Temporal filter, Target Separator and Classifier trainer
You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1
